Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Bukit Purmei" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(June 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Bukit Purmei**[note 1] [Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 武吉宝美; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Wǔjí Bǎoměi* is a small housing estate within [Bukit Merah](/wiki/Bukit_Merah) planning area in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), near [Telok Blangah](/wiki/Telok_Blangah) estate. Bukit Purmei consists of 15 [HDB](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) blocks, private apartments and landed property. Within the estate, there is Bukit Purmei Hillock Park, a Chinese temple, a church, a small Malay-Muslim cemetery and a [Malay shrine](/wiki/Datuk_Keramat) called [Keramat Bukit Kasita](/wiki/Keramat_Bukit_Kasita). The roads serving the estate are Bukit Purmei Ave, Bukit Purmei Rd and Bukit Teresa Rd. The name means "Serene Hill" in [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language). The word "Purmei" is an older spelling of the standard Malay "Permai" ("serene"). ## Amenities There are various shops at the void deck and bus stops in front of the blocks at the neighbourhood centre along Bukit Purmei Avenue. There are also two coffee shops, a [7-Eleven](/wiki/7-Eleven) store, two clinics, a Chinese medicinal shop, and a Mega Value shop at the neighbourhood centre. Two primary schools also serve the estate, namely CHIJ (Kellock) and Radin Mas Primary School. There is also the Bukit Purmei Hillock Park in the neighbourhood and [Mount Faber Park](/wiki/Mount_Faber_Park) is within a walk away. Tang Gah Beo (東嶽廟) is a prominent Chinese temple that was founded by Master Biyu in the 19th century. The temple was proposed for conservation under the Draft Master Plan 2013 by Urban Redevelopment Authority. ## Transport These services serve Bukit Purmei estate along Bukit Purmei Avenue. Service 123 - Runs between [Bukit Merah Interchange](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Bus_Interchange) and Beach Station Bus Terminal, [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa) via [Tiong Bahru MRT station](/wiki/Tiong_Bahru_MRT_station) and [Orchard Road](/wiki/Orchard_Road). Service 123M - A supplementary route of service 123 that runs between [HarbourFront Interchange](/wiki/HarbourFront_Bus_Interchange) and looping at Tiong Bahru Road Service 131 - Runs between [Saint Michael's Terminal](/wiki/List_of_bus_stations_in_Singapore#Saint_Michael's_Bus_Terminal) and [Bukit Merah Interchange](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Bus_Interchange). Alternatively, bus services 61, 124, 143 & 166 pass by Kampong Bahru Road at the south of the estate and bus services 65, 121, 195 & 855 pass by Lower Delta Road. ## Neighbouring areas ## Notes - Sbstransit.com.sg This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
